DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous Contrast Agent Bolus Infusion Timing Method Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identification of the manner in which the imaging agent was administered intravenously over time.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intravenous Contrast Agent Bolus Infusion Timing Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel._Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue._A single dose of drug usually injected into a blood vessel over a short period of time._The chronological relationship between temporal events._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel.:Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.

Concepts.definition: Into or within a vein. Intravenous usually refers to a way of giving a drug or other substance through a needle or tube inserted into a vein.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: A single dose of drug usually injected into a blood vessel over a short period of time.:The chronological relationship between temporal events.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A procedure in which a single dose of a pharmalogical substance is administered, generally via injection, over a short period of time.
The chronological relationship between temporal events.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Activation of a system without outside interference.: The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

A procedure in which a single dose of a pharmalogical substance is administered, generally via injection, over a short period of time.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cause to be firmly attached; stick or hold together and resist separation.: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.: Delay; time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time.

Concepts.definition: Cause to be firmly attached; stick or hold together and resist separation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.
